pull.title: Make the dummy argument to getaddednodeinfo optional

events.body:
I think we should simply remove the dummy argument for 0.14, and change the API, and mention that in the release notes.
To try to accommodate the old usage is unnecessary complexity, especially with regard to `bitcoin-cli` parsing.

Also need to get rid of this line in `src/rpc/client.cpp`:

```
{ "getaddednodeinfo", 0 }
```

issue.title: TODO for release notes 0.14.0
issue.body:
Post things here that need explicit mention in 0.14 release notes

I'd strongly prefer for pulls to just update `doc/release-notes.md` directly, but if they somehow slip by, mention them here.

Overview:
- [x] ZMQ on Windows (#8238) (done in wiki)
- Changed RPC calls:
  - [x] `getaddednodeinfo` got rid of first argument (#8272) (done in wiki)
  - [x] `getinfo` was deprecated (but not yet removed) (#8780) (done in wiki)
  - [x] `preciousblock` RPC call #6996
  - [x] `importmulti` RPC: #7551 
  - [x] `getmemoryinfo` #8753
  - [x] `setnetworkactive RPC (#8996)
- [x] Mention that the GUI confirmation target has been changed from the default of 25 to 6 (#9036).
- [x] Mempool dump to disk (#8448) (done in wiki)
- Several memory usage improvements 
  - [x] (shared pointers, LockedPool #8753)
  - [ ] Share unused mempool space with coin cache (#8610) 
- [x] Qt RPC nested commands: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/7783 (done in wiki)
- [x] Qt sensitive data filter: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/8877 (done in wiki)
- [x] Removal of priority estimation (#7730).
- [ ] Address relay changes (#8594, #8661, #8740).
- [x] Named RPC arguments (#8811).
- [x] Manual block file pruning (#7871)
- [x] Deprecate use of getrawtransaction for confirmed transactions with unspent outputs without -txindex (#9520).

~~**Note:** we're doing an experiment with editing the release notes draft in a github wiki.
The most up to date version of the release notes is thus at https://github.com/bitcoin-core/bitcoin-devwiki/wiki/0.14.0-Release-notes . Feel free to edit them there if you want to add any of these items.~~

events.body: Rebased, added to release nodes, and removed the rpccient.cpp line.
This still shows as conflicted. Did we merge something that conflicted while you were rebasing?

events.message: Make the dummy argument to getaddednodeinfo optional

events.body: @laanwj yes... #8638 conflicted in the release notes.

issue.title: p2p: Begin encapsulation
issue.body:
Includes following from Core:

https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/8113 - Rework addnode behaviour
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/8272 - Make the dummy argument to getaddednodeinfo optional
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/8085 - p2p: Begin encapsulation

Changes for features we don't support were discarded, including ban database, rpc/qt calls for banning and setting upload target.

issue.title: [RPC] Update getaddednodeinfo help example to remove dummy argument
issue.body:
- Command fails if true/false used as the example previously showed
- Related to bitcoin #8272 (in PR #1842)

comments.body: Was first a bit doubtful about this, and going to suggest to only allow skipping the dummy argument when the second argument is not provided. But all in all I like this trick. This allows a future path to getting rid of the argument completely.
Although I'm not sure how this interacts with bitcoin-cli's conversion table.

One downside I just realized: this likely does not work in bitcoin-cli
because it will try to interpret the first argument as JSON.

We could remove the parsing, though, which would make old-style calls fail.

Yes, that'd be a possible solution, it would break backwards compat for bitcoin-cli but not for direct JSON-RPC users.
Or we could go all the way, remove backwards compatibility completely and just mention it in the release notes. After all this is a rarely-used call.
